content.title: Splenic Artery Aneurysm

key_concepts.details: 60% of all visceral aneurysms; 0.8% autopsy incidence
Female predominance, multiparity, portal hypertension, pancreatitis
25% maternal mortality if rupture during pregnancy; treat pre-pregnancy if possible
>2cm, symptomatic, women of childbearing age, rapid growth

content.clinical_significance: Most common visceral aneurysm; pregnancy increases rupture risk

primary_sources: Abbas MA et al. J Vasc Surg 2002
